bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

div1.p: The writer informs Fricks that Carter is not willing to accept financial aid to attend a meeting.

div1.head: Letter to L.D. Fricks, October 25, 1921
div1.opener:
Form 199
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTER-OFFICE CORRESPONDENCE
October 25, 1921.
Dear Doctor Fricks:
div1.p:
On the receipt of a copy of your letter of
October 19 to me, Dr. H. R. Carter wrote stating that
he could not accept such a proposition. I had not
had opportunity to take the matter up with the Execu-
tive Committee. Feeling that Doctor Carter's wishes
in the matter should be our guide, I shall not present
the matter to the Executive Committee.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Dr. L. D. Fricks,
Room 17,
Court House Building,
Memphis, Tennessee.
JAF:EC 1 E
Copy to Doctor Carter
